page.title: 03Holiday Fun
page.content: Scarborough is a holiday tourist centre. On South Bay tourists hire deck chairs and wind breaks and try to get sun tanned while the little children dig in the sand, ride the donkeys and play in the ball pool or on the trampolines. When people get hungry they go to the fast food stalls on the foreshore. Here they can buy toffee apples, hot dogs, hamburgers, waffles, candyfloss, ice cream, pots of tea, fish and chips, pizzas and rock. There are lots of amusement arcades with video games and slot machines in an atmosphere of loud music and neon light. By the Harbour there is a fun fair with dodgems and a viking swing boat. When you are tired of all this, you can buy souvenirs of Scarborough from one of the many gift shops, before you set off home by car, train or coach.
